Apple___Apple_scab.quick_fix: Remove and destroy infected leaves and fallen debris. Apply fungicide spray immediately.
Apple___Apple_scab.permanent_fix: Plant resistant apple varieties like Liberty or Freedom. Ensure proper spacing for air circulation. Apply preventive fungicide in early spring before bud break.
Apple___Apple_scab.organic_fix: Spray neem oil (3%) mixed with water weekly. Apply compost tea to boost plant immunity. Use copper-based fungicide approved for organic use.

Apple___Black_rot.quick_fix: Prune and destroy all infected branches and fruit mummies. Disinfect pruning tools with bleach solution.
Apple___Black_rot.permanent_fix: Remove all mummified fruits from trees and ground. Improve drainage to reduce humidity. Apply fungicide during bloom and fruit development.
Apple___Black_rot.organic_fix: Apply lime sulfur spray during dormancy. Use Bacillus subtilis-based biological fungicide. Maintain tree vigor with organic compost.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.quick_fix: Remove galls from nearby cedar/juniper trees. Apply protective fungicide to apple trees.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.permanent_fix: Remove cedar trees within 1-2 miles if possible. Plant resistant varieties like Redfree or William's Pride. Apply fungicide starting at pink bud stage.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.organic_fix: Apply sulfur-based fungicide weekly during wet periods. Remove alternate host plants (cedars). Use resistant rootstock.

Apple___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Apple___healthy.permanent_fix: Continue regular care including proper watering, fertilization, and pruning.
Apple___healthy.organic_fix: Maintain soil health with compost and organic mulch.

Blueberry___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Blueberry___healthy.permanent_fix: Maintain acidic soil pH (4.5-5.5). Apply acidic fertilizer annually.
Blueberry___healthy.organic_fix: Mulch with pine needles or sawdust to maintain acidity.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.quick_fix: Prune infected shoots and leaves. Improve air circulation by thinning branches. Apply fungicide spray.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.permanent_fix: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation. Apply sulfur or synthetic fungicides starting at bud break.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.organic_fix: Spray potassium bicarbonate or neem oil. Apply milk solution (1:10 milk to water) weekly. Increase plant spacing.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.permanent_fix: Maintain regular pruning, fertilization, and pest monitoring.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.organic_fix: Apply compost mulch and beneficial insect habitat plants nearby.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.quick_fix: Remove crop residue after harvest. Apply fungicide if disease is severe and weather is wet.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.permanent_fix: Rotate with non-grass crops (soybeans, legumes). Plant resistant hybrids. Ensure proper plant spacing for airflow.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.organic_fix: Rotate crops with legumes. Apply compost to improve soil health. Use resistant open-pollinated varieties.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.quick_fix: Monitor for pustule development. Apply fungicide if rust is severe before tasseling.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.permanent_fix: Plant resistant hybrids. Rotate crops. Apply fungicide preventive spray in high-risk areas.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.organic_fix: Plant early maturing varieties to avoid peak rust season. Improve soil fertility with compost. Select resistant varieties.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.quick_fix: Destroy infected crop residue. Apply fungicide if lesions appear on upper leaves before tasseling.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.permanent_fix: Rotate with non-host crops. Plant resistant hybrids. Avoid continuous corn planting.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.organic_fix: Rotate with legumes or small grains. Remove and compost infected debris. Choose resistant varieties.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.permanent_fix: Maintain balanced fertilization, especially nitrogen. Monitor for pest pressure.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.organic_fix: Apply compost and practice crop rotation with legumes.

Grape___Black_rot.quick_fix: Remove and destroy all mummified berries and infected canes. Apply fungicide immediately.
Grape___Black_rot.permanent_fix: Practice strict sanitation - remove all infected material. Apply protective fungicide from bud break to harvest. Ensure good air circulation.
Grape___Black_rot.organic_fix: Apply copper sulfate or lime sulfur during dormancy. Use Bacillus subtilis sprays. Remove infected berries promptly.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).quick_fix: Prune out dead or dying wood. Avoid trunk injuries. Do not use pruning wound dressings.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).permanent_fix: Remove severely infected vines. Avoid stress - maintain proper irrigation and nutrition. Delay pruning until late winter.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).organic_fix: Maintain vine vigor with organic matter. Avoid heavy pruning cuts. Protect trunks from mechanical damage.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.quick_fix: Remove infected leaves. Improve air circulation. Apply copper-based fungicide.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.permanent_fix: Practice good canopy management. Apply preventive fungicides during wet periods. Ensure proper vineyard drainage.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.organic_fix: Apply copper oxychloride. Improve pruning for better airflow. Use compost tea sprays.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.pesticide_name: Copper oxychloride 50% WP or Mancozeb 75% WP

Grape___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Grape___healthy.permanent_fix: Maintain proper pruning, training, and canopy management.
Grape___healthy.organic_fix: Apply compost mulch and cover crops between rows.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).quick_fix: Remove and destroy infected trees immediately - there is no cure. Control psyllid insects with insecticide.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).permanent_fix: Plant certified disease-free nursery stock. Use resistant rootstock. Control Asian citrus psyllid vector rigorously.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).organic_fix: No organic cure available. Remove infected trees. Use reflective mulch to repel psyllids. Plant disease-free certified trees only.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).pesticide_name: Imidacloprid 17.8% SL or Dimethoate 30% EC (for psyllid control)

Peach___Bacterial_spot.quick_fix: Prune infected twigs. Apply copper-based bactericide. Avoid overhead irrigation.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.permanent_fix: Plant resistant varieties. Apply copper sprays during dormancy and early season. Improve air circulation.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.organic_fix: Apply copper sulfate during dormancy. Use neem oil sprays. Plant resistant varieties like Contender or Redhaven.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.pesticide_name: Copper hydroxide 50% WP or Oxytetracycline 17.5% SP

Peach___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Peach___healthy.permanent_fix: Maintain annual pruning, thinning, and balanced fertilization.
Peach___healthy.organic_fix: Apply compost mulch and practice integrated pest management.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.quick_fix: Remove infected leaves and fruits. Apply copper-based bactericide. Avoid working with wet plants.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.permanent_fix: Use certified disease-free seeds. Rotate crops 2-3 years. Apply copper sprays preventively during wet weather.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.organic_fix: Apply copper oxychloride. Use raised beds for better drainage. Plant resistant varieties like Bell Boy or California Wonder.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.pesticide_name: Copper hydroxide 50% WP or Streptomycin sulfate 90% SP

Pepper,_bell___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.permanent_fix: Maintain consistent watering and balanced fertilization with calcium.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.organic_fix: Apply compost and mulch to maintain even soil moisture.

Potato___Early_blight.quick_fix: Remove lower infected leaves. Apply fungicide spray. Ensure adequate potassium fertilization.
Potato___Early_blight.permanent_fix: Rotate with non-solanaceous crops for 3 years. Use certified seed potatoes. Apply preventive fungicides.
Potato___Early_blight.organic_fix: Apply copper-based fungicide. Use compost tea sprays. Plant resistant varieties like Kennebec or Defender.

Potato___Late_blight.quick_fix: Destroy all infected plants immediately. Apply systemic fungicide urgently. Stop irrigation to reduce humidity.
Potato___Late_blight.permanent_fix: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure excellent drainage. Apply protective fungicides before disease appears. Practice crop rotation.
Potato___Late_blight.organic_fix: Apply copper-based fungicide preventively. Use resistant varieties like Defender or Sarpo Mira. Improve air circulation.
Potato___Late_blight.pesticide_name: Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP or Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP

Potato___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Potato___healthy.permanent_fix: Hill soil around stems. Maintain consistent soil moisture. Monitor for pest pressure.
Potato___healthy.organic_fix: Use certified organic seed potatoes. Apply compost mulch.

Raspberry___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Raspberry___healthy.permanent_fix: Prune old canes after fruiting. Maintain trellis system. Apply balanced fertilizer.
Raspberry___healthy.organic_fix: Apply compost mulch. Plant companion plants like chives or garlic.

Soybean___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Soybean___healthy.permanent_fix: Inoculate seeds with rhizobium bacteria. Maintain proper plant population.
Soybean___healthy.organic_fix: Use certified organic seeds. Rotate with corn or small grains.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.quick_fix: Remove severely infected leaves. Apply fungicide or neem oil spray. Increase air circulation.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.permanent_fix: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead watering. Apply preventive fungicides when conditions favor disease.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.organic_fix: Spray milk solution (1:9 milk to water). Apply potassium bicarbonate. Use neem oil weekly.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.quick_fix: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicide. Avoid overhead irrigation.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.permanent_fix: Plant certified disease-free plants. Space plants for air circulation. Mulch with straw to prevent splash.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.organic_fix: Apply copper-based fungicide. Use straw mulch. Remove infected leaves promptly.

Strawberry___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Strawberry___healthy.permanent_fix: Renovate bed after harvest. Remove old leaves. Apply balanced fertilizer.
Strawberry___healthy.organic_fix: Mulch with straw. Apply compost between rows.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.quick_fix: Remove infected leaves and fruits. Apply copper spray. Avoid working with wet plants. Disinfect tools.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.permanent_fix: Use certified disease-free seeds. Rotate crops 3 years. Apply copper preventively. Use drip irrigation.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.organic_fix: Apply copper oxychloride. Use resistant varieties like Mountain Magic or Defiant. Space plants widely.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.pesticide_name: Copper hydroxide 50% WP or Streptomycin sulfate 90% SP

Tomato___Early_blight.quick_fix: Remove lower infected leaves. Apply fungicide. Mulch to prevent soil splash. Stake plants.
Tomato___Early_blight.permanent_fix: Rotate crops 3 years. Use resistant varieties. Apply preventive fungicides. Ensure good air circulation.
Tomato___Early_blight.organic_fix: Apply copper spray. Use compost tea. Plant resistant varieties like Iron Lady or Defiant. Mulch heavily.

Tomato___Late_blight.quick_fix: Remove and destroy ALL infected plants immediately. Apply systemic fungicide urgently. Stop overhead watering.
Tomato___Late_blight.permanent_fix: Plant resistant varieties like Mountain Magic or Defiant. Ensure excellent drainage. Apply preventive fungicides before wet weather.
Tomato___Late_blight.organic_fix: Apply copper spray weekly. Use resistant varieties. Remove volunteer tomato plants. Ensure 3-year crop rotation.
Tomato___Late_blight.pesticide_name: Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP or Dimethomorph 50% WP

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.quick_fix: Increase ventilation in greenhouse. Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicide. Lower humidity.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.permanent_fix: Use resistant varieties. Ensure excellent air circulation. Avoid overhead watering. Space plants properly.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.organic_fix: Improve ventilation. Apply copper spray. Use resistant varieties like Iron Lady. Mulch to reduce humidity.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.quick_fix: Remove lower infected leaves. Apply fungicide. Mulch to prevent splash. Remove plant debris.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.permanent_fix: Rotate crops 2-3 years. Use resistant varieties. Apply preventive fungicides. Ensure good drainage.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.organic_fix: Apply copper spray. Remove infected leaves weekly. Use compost mulch. Plant resistant varieties.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.quick_fix: Spray plants with strong water jet to dislodge mites. Apply miticide or insecticidal soap. Increase humidity.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.permanent_fix: Maintain proper irrigation - drought stress increases mite problems. Apply preventive miticides. Remove weeds that host mites.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.organic_fix: Apply neem oil or insecticidal soap. Release predatory mites. Spray with water twice daily for 3 days.

Tomato___Target_Spot.quick_fix: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicide. Improve air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.
Tomato___Target_Spot.permanent_fix: Rotate crops 2-3 years. Use resistant varieties. Apply preventive fungicides. Remove crop residue.
Tomato___Target_Spot.organic_fix: Apply copper spray. Remove infected debris. Use compost mulch. Space plants for airflow.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.quick_fix: Remove and destroy infected plants immediately. Control whiteflies with insecticide. Use reflective mulch.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.permanent_fix: Plant resistant varieties like TYLCV-resistant hybrids. Use reflective mulch to repel whiteflies. Screen greenhouse vents.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.organic_fix: Remove infected plants immediately. Use reflective silver mulch. Release Encarsia wasps for whitefly control. Plant resistant varieties.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.pesticide_name: Imidacloprid 17.8% SL or Acetamiprid 20% SP (for whitefly control)

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.quick_fix: Remove and destroy infected plants. Disinfect hands and tools with soap/bleach. Control aphids.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.permanent_fix: Use resistant varieties like Celebrity or Big Beef. Plant certified disease-free seeds. Practice strict sanitation. Remove weeds.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.organic_fix: Plant resistant varieties. Remove infected plants. Control aphids with neem oil. Wash hands before handling plants.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.pesticide_name: No chemical cure available - use resistant varieties

Tomato___healthy.quick_fix: Your plant looks healthy! No action needed.
Tomato___healthy.permanent_fix: Continue staking, pruning suckers, and consistent watering. Apply balanced fertilizer.
Tomato___healthy.organic_fix: Mulch with straw or compost. Use organic fertilizer. Practice companion planting with basil or marigolds.
